The Chief of the General Staff () is the highest-ranking and most senior military officer of the Armed Forces of the Czech Republic. He is appointed by the president of the Czech Republic, who is the commander-in-chief. The current chief of the general staff is Army General Karel Řehka.
List of officeholders
For period from 1919 to 1992, see Chief of the General Staff of Czechoslovakia.
